isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - INJECTION CONTROL PRESSURE (ICP) SENSOR - SIGNAL FUNCTIONS

svcproc.title: SIGNAL FUNCTIONS
svcproc.para: The Injection Control Pressure (ICP) sensor is a variable capacitance sensor that when supplied with a 5 volt reference signal from the ECM produces a linear analog voltage signal that indicates pressure.

The ICP sensor's primary function is to provide a feedback signal to indicate injection control pressure to enable the ECM to command the correct injector timing and pulse width and the correct injection control pressure for proper fuel delivery at all speed and load conditions.
